name: sprite.isTouching()
content:
Checks if the sprite is touching the target sprite or any sprite in the target group.

All sprites have a collider area that defines the active area to detect collisions with other sprites and mouse interactions.  Use `setCollider` to change the default collider area, a rectangle, for a sprite.

examples.name: Going for Gold
examples.description: Will a randomly started sprite eventually touch a random static sprite?

palette_params.name: target
palette_params.description: The name of the target sprite or target group you want to check for touching.

short_description: Checks if the sprite is touching the target sprite or any sprite in the target group.
tips: - To fine tune your collision detection use `setCollider` to change the shape and size of the collider area and set `debug` to true for the sprites.
